tasks: Create a list of 10 common product thinking and strategy mistakes to avoid in UX design, referencing the 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design (nngroup.com). Score your own understanding on a scale of 1-5, with 1 being 'I'm not sure' and 5 being 'I fully understand'.
Redesign the navigation menu of a popular design tool using Occam's Razor (lawsofux.com) to simplify it. Document your thought process and decisions in a 2-page report.

Sketch out 3 different wireframe prototypes for a hypothetical product feature, focusing on UI Craft & Visual Design principles from Aesthetic-Usability Effect (lawsofux.com). Get feedback from at least one peer or mentor.

Develop a 5-point plan to improve Product Thinking & Strategy in your current projects, incorporating the concepts learned from Occam's Razor and Miller’s Law (lawsofux.com). Present it to your team or manager for feedback.
Conduct a user research study on a specific pain point using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Document 5 key findings and propose solutions in a 3-page report.
Create an interactive prototype of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on UI Craft & Visual Design principles from Occam’s Razor (lawsofux.com). Get feedback from at least one peer or mentor.

Develop a comprehensive guide to Product Thinking & Strategy for UX designers, incorporating the concepts learned from Occam's Razor and Miller’s Law (lawsofux.com). Share it with your team or online community.
Create a user research study on a specific pain point using the Jobs-to-be-Done framework. Document 10 key findings and propose solutions in a 5-page report.
Design an e-commerce product feature, focusing on UI Craft & Visual Design principles from Occam’s Razor (lawsofux.com). Get feedback from at least one peer or mentor.

Develop a comprehensive case study of how you applied Product Thinking & Strategy in a previous project, incorporating the concepts learned throughout this 4-week plan. Share it with your team or online community.

Create an interactive prototype of a hypothetical product feature, focusing on UI Craft & Visual Design principles from Occam’s Razor (lawsofux.com). Get feedback from at least one peer or mentor and incorporate their suggestions into the final design.
Design a comprehensive UX strategy for a new product feature, incorporating all the concepts learned throughout this 4-week plan. Present it to your team or manager for feedback.

resources.readup: As a Strategic Lead UX Designer, you have the unique opportunity to drive user-centered design decisions that shape the future of products and services. By leveraging your strengths in collaboration, communication, and product thinking, you can foster a culture of empathy and inclusivity, creating experiences that delight and empower users.

resources.title: 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design
resources.description: 7 10 Usability Heuristics for User Interface Design ================================================= Jakob Nielsen ![](https://media.nngroup.com/medi...

topics.name: Applying Occam's Razor for UI Design Decisions
topics.summary: Developing a clear understanding of Occam's Razor will help Strategic Leads make data-driven design decisions and avoid unnecessary complexity in their designs.
practice_points: Analyze 3 existing UI designs that could be simplified using Occam's Razor and propose 2 alternative, simpler solutions for each
Create a style guide that incorporates Occam's Razor principles, including clear typography and limited color palettes
Conduct a usability testing session with 5 participants and analyze the results to identify areas where Occam's Razor could be applied

topics.name: Using Tesler’s Law for Information Architecture
topics.summary: Understanding Tesler’s Law will enable Strategic Leads to create more intuitive and user-friendly information architectures that minimize cognitive load.
practice_points: Design an information architecture for a new e-commerce website using Tesler’s Law, including clear navigation and categorization
Analyze the existing info architecture of 3 popular websites and propose improvements based on Tesler’s Law
Create a set of heuristics for evaluating the usability of information architectures against Tesler’s Law

topics.name: Integrating Hick’s Law into Design Decisions
topics.summary: Applying Hick’s Law will help Strategic Leads optimize the speed and efficiency of their designs, reducing user frustration and increasing overall satisfaction.
practice_points: Conduct a usability testing session with 5 participants to evaluate the impact of response time on user performance, using Hick’s Law as a guide
Analyze the existing design decisions of 3 colleagues and propose improvements based on Hick’s Law
Create a set of guidelines for designing interactive elements that balance speed and accuracy
